summary: This document is an email chain between defense attorney Michael Bachner and a prosecutor regarding an attorney proffer for an unnamed female client. The emails discuss clarifying the client's visits to various Jeffrey Epstein properties and confirm the legal protections (FRE 408 and 410) under which the proffer statements are made.

persons.name: Michael Bachner
persons.context: Attorney representing an unnamed female client, communicating with prosecutors to provide a preliminary attorney proffer regarding his client's knowledge and visits to Epstein properties.

connections.description: Michael Bachner is the legal representative for an unnamed female client, preparing and submitting an attorney proffer on her behalf to prosecutors.

events.title: Attorney Proffer Meeting Scheduled
events.description: Michael Bachner emails a prosecutor to confirm that statements made in an upcoming meeting are preliminary and intended to be covered under FRE 408 and 410 protections.

events.title: Clarification on Client's Travel
events.description: Prosecutor follows up on a meeting, asking for clarification on whether Bachner's client ever visited specific Epstein properties beyond the New York mansion and Palm Beach residence.

events.title: Attorney Provides Replies
events.description: Michael Bachner sends attached replies to the prosecutor's questions regarding the client proffer.

events.title: Prosecutor Acknowledges Information
events.description: A prosecutor acknowledges receipt of Bachner's information, states it doesn't change their view, and plans to discuss next steps the following week.

keyFacts: An attorney proffer is being made for an unnamed female client regarding her knowledge of and visits to Jeffrey Epstein's properties.
The client reportedly stayed in a Paris apartment with her husband on one occasion and visited the Palm Beach residence once.
Prosecutors sought clarification on whether the client visited Epstein's New Mexico ranch, Little St. James Island, Great St. James Island, and/or Paris residence.
The proffer statements are made under the protections of Federal Rules of Evidence 408 and 410, which relate to the inadmissibility of settlement offers and plea discussions.
The email chain reveals ongoing cooperation and information exchange between defense counsel and prosecutors in the Epstein investigation circa February 2020.
